meanings.definition: To propel a boat forward by pushing a pole against the bottom of a river or lake.
meanings.sent1: She was punting the boat gently along the calm river.
meanings.sent2: The guide expertly demonstrated punting on the serene lake.
meanings.sent3: While punting, he accidentally splashed water on his friend.
meanings.sent4: The graceful movement of punting resembled a dance on water.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of punting echoed across the tranquil lake.

meanings.definition: To kick a ball high into the air in a game such as football.
meanings.sent1: He was punting the football towards the goal post.
meanings.sent2: The player practiced punting the ball to improve his technique.
meanings.sent3: During the game, his powerful punting surprised the opponents.
meanings.sent4: Her punt soared through the air like a bird taking flight.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the perfect punt sailed through the sky.

meanings.definition: To make a bet on a horse race without knowing the odds.
meanings.sent1: They were punting on the horse with the unique name.
meanings.sent2: Punting on the race added excitement to their day at the track.
meanings.sent3: His risky punting strategy paid off with a surprising win.
meanings.sent4: She felt a rush of adrenaline when punting on the underdog.
meanings.sent5: The group celebrated their successful punt on the unexpected winner.
